comment._content:
This is the corner of North 10th and East Broad. The church is the Broad Street Methodist Church and the Ford dealer is Richmond Ford, later moved to Westmoreland and West Broad. City Hall is now on the old Richmond Ford site and the parking lot behind the Eye and Ear Hospital on the church site.

The church moved to River Road in 1960 and was renamed River Road (United) Methodist Church.

comment.author: 7541340@N08
comment._content: The church looks like a solid building.  Must have took some knocking down.

comment.author: 64339620@N07
comment._content: This was one of the major losses to Richmond's architectural heritage. The City tore the building down for a "temporary parking lot for 22 cars" after a MAJOR fight to preserve the building. Designed by the major 19th century Richmond architect Albert West, this was one of his finest buildings. It was a lovely building, built in 1858 and it was structurally very sound.
